TF031974-FYR - MACEDONIA - FINANCIAL SECTOR,TF031972-FYR MACEDONIA - FINANCIAL SECTOR,TF029305-PHRD-PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT II,TF029115-PHRD-POST PRIV. RESTRUCTURING

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory, with
            a likely sustainability. Lessons drawn from the project
            suggest that lending through intermediaries should intensify
            technical assistance at the early stages of project
            implementation, particularly in transition economies, where
            it is difficult to introduce policy changes, and build
            ownership. Technical assistance should be coordinated, and
            integrated into a long-term strategic plan for the
            development of commercial banks, and thus achieve
            sustainable institutional development impact. The
            establishment of an independent agency, is essential in
            attaining discipline by the Borrower, as well as a formal
            Fiscal Agency Agreement is critical to compliance with the
            Loan Agreement's financial, environmental, and other
            applicable legal covenants. Furthermore, early ownership of
            project design, and clear institutional arrangements,
            facilitate capacity building. Such capacity could then focus
            on the competitive aspects of a limited number of
            financially strong banks, rather than aiming at including
            all possible smaller banks, a choice inherent in meeting
            objectives, but a trade-off that needs to be revised. It is
            questionable whether the need to keep an independent agency
            after project closure is valid, for provided the
            participating financial institutions fulfill the
            qualification criteria, discretionary credit could be used
            as an untied source of financing.
